Stob Coire Raineach (Buachaille Etive Beag)

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Stob Coire Raineach - the northern summit of Buachaille Etive Beag - became a Munro in its own right in 1997. Its broad summit has great views of the Aonach Eagach.

 You have not climbed Stob Coire Raineach (Buachaille Etive Beag).

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 925 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.92/5
Rating: 3.9/5 (112 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Buachaille Etive Beag from Glencoe

Other routes and challenges

The wee Buachaille can also be climbed from Glen Etive. Use the car park near Dalness, then head back up the road and start on the Lairig Gartain / Lairig Eilde right of way. Leave this to ascend to direct SSW ridge to the summit of Stob Dubh - there is some scree higher up. From the bealach between the two peaks a descent can be made to the River Coupall, returning to the start through the Lairig Gartain.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Glencoe Hotels

Glencoe B&B

Glencoe Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
